City Hall, Baltimore to Ocean City, Md. via Denton, Georgetown

Via Millers ISland BridZe. o .. s a: s i 6555560 65 5005 8000506 85055 55055 95 8 80 n s 595505 5450 55058 5 2usd 5,51 4 134.4

DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED BRIDGE AT MILLERS ISLAND

The plans for the Chesapeake Bay Bridge between Millers Island and
Tolchester provide for the construction of a two lane highway and bridge
beginning at Patapsco River Neck, thence across the inlet to Hart Island,
across Hart Island, across the inlet to Millers Island, across Millers Island to
its northeast point, and from this point straight across the Chesapeake
Bay to the Eastern Shore of Maryland, in the vicinity of Tolchester. For
detailed information refer to ‘“Plan and Profile,” Plates 84 and 85. The
inlets above described are crossed by means of concrete pile trestle con-
struction. The Islands are crossed by means of filled causeways. The
filled causeway, also, is proposed to extend out into the Bay for a distance
of about 2100 feet from the northeast tip of Millers Island. The crossing
from the end of this causeway to the Eastern Shore is effected by means of
a steel bridge supported on concrete piers. The bridge and its approaches
are more than ten miles long.

The plans submitted to the War Department provided for two main chan-
nel crossings. Each of these main channel crossings consisted of cantilever
spans 716 feet long, flanked on each side by anchor spans 358 feetlong. The
span over the west channel, due to the skew at which the channel crosses
under the bridge, provided for a lateral clearance of 490 feet, measured nor-
